channel.title: Everything changes now...god save the green (Jagex a US company)
channel.description:
I wanted to post this yesterday, but the site was being a bitch. Anyway...
http://massively.joystiq.com/2012/01/09/god-save-the-green-deal-makes-jagex-a-us-company/
This is the best explanation as of yet for the SOF and other promotions. To make some connections for those who are tl;dr, Andrew sold his remaining shares to a large Jagex investor, giving them the majority of ownership in the company. Jagex's profits last year were very low, and they lost almost half of their member base in the 4th quarter from removing bots. It doesn't take much logic to figure out that they are in some serious financial trouble this year. Their investors are looking to make some money on the company, not watch it go bankrupt. So at this point, SOF and raised membership costs are all that's keeping RuneScape from being lost to bankruptcy. This is not far exaggerated.
It seems Andrew may have finally given up on the game that made him famous over a decade ago.

item.title: Everything changes now...god save the green (Jagex a US company)
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:23, topic:438469”][quote author=t4 link=topic=541187.msg3964471#msg3964471 date=1333575992]

they should sell the source code the RSC to a 3rd part(ies) for profit and joy for all vets of RS.

Would make them lose money in the long run.
[/quote]How? RSC is way outdated to gain too much profits from.

Would take veterans away from runescape. Also the players that might have joined runescape now can decide between another game. It just isn’t in Jagex’s interest to release rsc.

people that are rsc players are already playing rsce or w/e (rsps). they could get rid of two servers (the rsc servers) too.

The reason they won’t give out rsc is because we could look at the source code and use it to make rs2 servers.[/quote]Ridiculous, you do realize that RSC is technically nothing like RS2 whatsoever right?

Read full topic
item.source: Everything changes now...god save the green (Jagex a US company)

item.title: Everything changes now...god save the green (Jagex a US company)
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:30, topic:438469”]They really should just downsize more world wise and staff wise to fit their playerbase (really remove a lot of the f2p worlds, lets face it, there are tons that have less than 500 on constantly, and the majority of those are probably gold farmers). That way they can stop losing more members by creating horrible money making schemes, and focus more on keeping the current playerbase happy. Then work the game back up again, just like they did so many years ago.[/quote]support++

Read full topic
item.source: Everything changes now...god save the green (Jagex a US company)

item.title: Everything changes now...god save the green (Jagex a US company)
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:30, topic:438469”]They really should just downsize more world wise and staff wise to fit their playerbase (really remove a lot of the f2p worlds, lets face it, there are tons that have less than 500 on constantly, and the majority of those are probably gold farmers). That way they can stop losing more members by creating horrible money making schemes, and focus more on keeping the current playerbase happy. Then work the game back up again, just like they did so many years ago.[/quote]That being said, if they cut down, they would have to cut down on employees also, and its hard to build a team, let them go, and try to rebuild again. I believe they have their own building, merchandise franchise, ect. Its hard to cut back on certain things

Read full topic

item.title: Everything changes now...god save the green (Jagex a US company)
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:26, topic:438469”][quote author=Eh Pretty Easy link=topic=541187.msg3964527#msg3964527 date=1333579449]
No one would honestly pay a thing to play the shithole known as RSC. I used to play it a loooooooong time ago, but frankly it doesn’t have the appeal anymore - did it even have any to begin with? :S
[/quote]

In RSC you have to work for your shit, it’s an actual grind, items have value, skills have value. Pking is not two hit claw bs. You said “No one” but speak for yourself, there are plenty of rsc fans still around and when a legitimate servers shows up every now and then you will see a glimpse of the rsc community.[/quote]
I never played rsc
but I would get back on rs for 317 - 450 fuck all the rest

Read full topic

item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:16, topic:438469”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=541187.msg3964387#msg3964387 date=1333572262]

they should sell the source code the RSC to a 3rd part(ies) for profit and joy for all vets of RS.

Would make them lose money in the long run.
[/quote]How? RSC is way outdated to gain too much profits from.

Would take veterans away from runescape. Also the players that might have joined runescape now can decide between another game. It just isn’t in Jagex’s interest to release rsc.

people that are rsc players are already playing rsce or w/e (rsps). they could get rid of two servers (the rsc servers) too.[/quote]

The reason they won’t give out rsc is because we could look at the source code and use it to make rs2 servers. The rsc community would flourish (if open source) other than that, they should open it back up for $5 USD a month… would be around $20,000 minimum on the first month due to members. (The rs2 members would need a different sub )
